definition: strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort
to force (sb to do sth)/to compel/to press for/to extort/to press on towards/to press up to/to close in on/euphemistic variant of 屄[bi1]

sentences.english: They WILL learn something at every opportunity you don't have to force it.
sentences.chinese: 他们会在每个机会学东西，你不用强逼他们。

sentences.english: The Amorites confined the Danites to the hill country, not allowing them to come down into the plain.
sentences.chinese: 亚摩利人强逼但人住在山地，不容他们下到平原。

sentences.english: The legalization of addictive drugs would in no way force individuals into the habit.
sentences.chinese: 成瘾性药物的合法化，绝不会强逼人们吸毒成性。

sentences.english: And the Amorites forced the children of Dan into the mountain: for they would not suffer them to come down to the valley
sentences.chinese: 亚摩利人强逼但人住在山地，不容他们下到平原。

sentences.english: ' He won't force it on to you, but he waits to give it to you.
sentences.chinese: 祂不会强逼你接受，但祂等着把救恩给你。

sentences.english: Ruan Joe rushed told his son to apologize, but l don't want to make him escape.
sentences.chinese: 阮乔见状叫儿子道歉，但逸升不想强逼他。

sentences.english: Do not let me alone, plz.
sentences.chinese: 我不要再忍耐和强逼自己忘记从前。

sentences.english: The North has previously used aggression to force negotiations.
sentences.chinese: 朝鲜此前惯于利用咄咄态势来强逼进行谈判。

definition: to pressure/to press/to force/to compel/to push/to coerce/to urge/to impel/to bully into/to be compelled
to question intensely/to interrogate/to demand information
to vow to die rather than obey (idiom)
